intro: Dalechampia clematidifolia var. dumetorum, commonly known as the roughleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has heart-shaped, rough-textured leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. This variety is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its rugged appearance.
